casebody.data:
Bernard v. Herbert. Detinue will lie for a slave, although the defendant obtained the possession tor-tiously. Detinue for a slave. Mr. Wise, for the defendant, Mr. Neale, for the plaintiff,

prayed the Court to instruct the jury, that if the defendant obtained possession of the slave tor-tiously, the plaintiff cannot recover in this cause; and cited Selw. N. P.

was stopped by the Court, who said that the plaintiff might waive the trespass, and refused to give the instruction.
